title: Yeti

* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").

* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                      |

| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | [monst.c#line1935](/wiki/Monst.c#line1935 "Monst.c") |

A **yeti**, Y, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [apelike creature](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A yeti possesses two claw attacks and a bite attack.

Eating a yeti corpse has a 1⁄3 chance of conveying [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 Lethe patch](#Lethe_patch)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 Monster stats by variant](#Monster_stats_by_variant)

- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated yetis are always created hostile.

Yetis appear among the random Y that make up the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Healer quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest").

## Strategy

The yeti is dangerous for early-game characters and must be dealt with carefully: while it cannot grab the player like a [carnivorous ape](/wiki/Carnivorous_ape "Carnivorous ape"), its 15 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") is faster than the largest ape and unhasted characters.

With a small bit of preparation, you can blunt a yeti's damage with high [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"), or else safely deal with it from a distance: engraving [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") can scare it off, allowing you to follow up with any ranged attacks at your disposal. [Multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") projectiles, offensive spells and wands are ideal, especially if you can exploit the yeti's [vulnerability](/wiki/Vulnerability "Vulnerability") to fire. The yeti's own 6 AC is low enough that even a mediocre spellcaster can kill a yeti with a few uses of the [force bolt](/wiki/Spellbook_of_force_bolt "Spellbook of force bolt") spell; non-casters can do the same with a [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking").

## History

The yeti first appears in PDP-11 Hack, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial bestiary for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), the yeti was the sole member of its monster class monster - in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), the apelike creature [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") is moved from A to its current glyph, and the yeti is merged into the monster class, with its macro repurposed to represent them.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Yeti](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yeti "wikipedia:Yeti")***

The Yeti, or Abominable Snowman, is an iconic cryptozoological animal said to inhabit the Himalayan region of Nepal and Tibet. Folklorists trace the origin of the Yeti to a combination of factors, including the folklore of pre-Buddhist Himalayan cultures such as the [Sherpa people](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherpa_people "wikipedia:Sherpa people"), and misidentified fauna such as bears or yak.

The Yeti is often described as being a large, bipedal ape-like creature that is covered with brown, gray, or white hair, and it is sometimes depicted as having large, sharp teeth.

## Variants

Variants of *NetHack* typically make it impossible for yetis to generate in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), as they are weak to fire.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), yetis can be tamed by throwing them bananas.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Yetis also [hit other monsters as a +1 weapon](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon").

### Lethe patch

In the [Lethe patch](/wiki/Lethe_patch "Lethe patch"), seven yetis are generated in the lair of [Geryon](/wiki/Geryon "Geryon") within [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom_\(Lethe_patch\) "Gehennom (Lethe patch)").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the weight of a yeti's corpse is increased by 1000 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") (more than 50%), and their base experience is increased; they can also no longer be tamed.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), yeti have their base experience decreased to 29 and cannot appear in Gehennom, but are otherwise identical to vanilla yeti.

## Monster stats by variant

- EvilHack

## Encyclopedia entry

The Abominable Snowman, or yeti, is one of the truly great  
unknown animals of the twentieth century. It is a large hairy  
biped that lives in the Himalayan region of Asia ... The story  
of the Abominable Snowman is filled with mysteries great and  
small, and one of the most difficult of all is how it got that  
awful name. The creature is neither particularly abominable,  
nor does it necessarily live in the snows. \_Yeti\_ is a Tibetan  
word which may apply either to a real, but unknown animal of  
the Himalayas, or to a mountain spirit or demon -- no one is  
quite sure which. And after nearly half a century in which  
Westerners have trampled around looking for the yeti, and  
asking all sorts of questions, the original native traditions  
concerning the creature have become even more muddled and  
confused.

\[ The Encyclopedia of Monsters, by Daniel Cohen ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 65](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L65)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 134](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L134)

Yeti

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the macro used to define all apelike creatures, see S_YETI.
Y yeti
Difficulty 7
Attacks Claw 1d6, Claw 1d6, Bite 1d4
Y yeti
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Claw 1d6, Claw 1d6, Bite 1d4

Base level 5
Base experience 59
Speed 15
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1600
Nutritional value 700
Size Large
Resistances Cold
Resistances conveyed Cold (33%)

A yeti:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line1935

A yeti, Y, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a strong and carnivorous apelike creature that can be seen via infravision.

A yeti possesses two claw attacks and a bite attack.

Eating a yeti corpse has a 1⁄3 chance of conveying cold resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 Lethe patch
    • 5.3 dNetHack
    • 5.4 EvilHack
  • 6 Monster stats by variant
  • 7 Encyclopedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

Randomly generated yetis are always created hostile.

Yetis appear among the random Y that make up the second quest monster class for Healers and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Healer quest.

Strategy

The yeti is dangerous for early-game characters and must be dealt with carefully: while it cannot grab the player like a carnivorous ape, its 15 speed is faster than the largest ape and unhasted characters.

With a small bit of preparation, you can blunt a yeti's damage with high AC, or else safely deal with it from a distance: engraving Elbereth can scare it off, allowing you to follow up with any ranged attacks at your disposal. Multishot projectiles, offensive spells and wands are ideal, especially if you can exploit the yeti's vulnerability to fire. The yeti's own 6 AC is low enough that even a mediocre spellcaster can kill a yeti with a few uses of the force bolt spell; non-casters can do the same with a wand of striking.

History

The yeti first appears in PDP-11 Hack, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial bestiary for Hack 1.0. From this version to NetHack 3.0.10, the yeti was the sole member of its monster class monster - in NetHack 3.1.0, the apelike creature monster class is moved from A to its current glyph, and the yeti is merged into the monster class, with its macro repurposed to represent them.[1][2]

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Yeti

The Yeti, or Abominable Snowman, is an iconic cryptozoological animal said to inhabit the Himalayan region of Nepal and Tibet. Folklorists trace the origin of the Yeti to a combination of factors, including the folklore of pre-Buddhist Himalayan cultures such as the Sherpa people, and misidentified fauna such as bears or yak.

The Yeti is often described as being a large, bipedal ape-like creature that is covered with brown, gray, or white hair, and it is sometimes depicted as having large, sharp teeth.

Variants

Variants of NetHack typically make it impossible for yetis to generate in Gehennom, as they are weak to fire.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, yetis can be tamed by throwing them bananas.[3] Yetis also hit other monsters as a +1 weapon.

Lethe patch

In the Lethe patch, seven yetis are generated in the lair of Geryon within Gehennom.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, the weight of a yeti's corpse is increased by 1000 aum (more than 50%), and their base experience is increased; they can also no longer be tamed.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, yeti have their base experience decreased to 29 and cannot appear in Gehennom, but are otherwise identical to vanilla yeti.

Encyclopedia entry

The Abominable Snowman, or yeti, is one of the truly great
unknown animals of the twentieth century. It is a large hairy
biped that lives in the Himalayan region of Asia ... The story
of the Abominable Snowman is filled with mysteries great and
small, and one of the most difficult of all is how it got that
awful name. The creature is neither particularly abominable,
nor does it necessarily live in the snows. _Yeti_ is a Tibetan
word which may apply either to a real, but unknown animal of
the Himalayas, or to a mountain spirit or demon -- no one is
quite sure which. And after nearly half a century in which
Westerners have trampled around looking for the yeti, and
asking all sorts of questions, the original native traditions
concerning the creature have become even more muddled and
confused.

[ The Encyclopedia of Monsters, by Daniel Cohen ]

 |reference=[[monst.c#line1935]]
}}

A '''yeti''', {{monsym|yeti}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[strong]] and [[carnivorous]] [[apelike creature]] that can be seen via [[infravision]].

A yeti possesses two claw attacks and a bite attack.

Eating a yeti corpse has a {{frac|3}} chance of conveying [[cold resistance]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated yetis are always created hostile.

Yetis appear among the random {{white|Y}} that make up the second [[quest]] [[monster class]] for [[Healer]]s and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Healer quest]]. 

==Strategy==
The yeti is dangerous for early-game characters and must be dealt with carefully: while it cannot grab the player like a [[carnivorous ape]], its 15 [[speed]] is faster than the largest ape and unhasted characters.

With a small bit of preparation, you can blunt a yeti's damage with high [[AC]], or else safely deal with it from a distance: engraving [[Elbereth]] can scare it off, allowing you to follow up with any ranged attacks at your disposal. [[Multishot]] projectiles, offensive spells and wands are ideal, especially if you can exploit the yeti's [[vulnerability]] to fire. The yeti's own 6 AC is low enough that even a mediocre spellcaster can kill a yeti with a few uses of the {{spell of|force bolt}} spell; non-casters can do the same with a [[wand of striking]].

==History==
The yeti first appears in PDP-11 Hack, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial bestiary for [[Hack 1.0]]. From this version to [[NetHack 3.0.10]], the yeti was the sole member of its monster class monster - in [[NetHack 3.1.0]], the apelike creature [[monster class]] is moved from {{white|A}} to its current glyph, and the yeti is merged into the monster class, with its macro repurposed to represent them.{{refsrc|include/monsym.h|65|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|include/monsym.h|134|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Yeti}}
The Yeti, or Abominable Snowman, is an iconic cryptozoological animal said to inhabit the Himalayan region of Nepal and Tibet. Folklorists trace the origin of the Yeti to a combination of factors, including the folklore of pre-Buddhist Himalayan cultures such as the [[wikipedia:Sherpa people|Sherpa people]], and misidentified fauna such as bears or yak.

The Yeti is often described as being a large, bipedal ape-like creature that is covered with brown, gray, or white hair, and it is sometimes depicted as having large, sharp teeth.

==Variants==
Variants of ''NetHack'' typically make it impossible for yetis to generate in [[Gehennom]], as they are weak to fire.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], yetis can be tamed by throwing them bananas.{{refsrc|dog.c|802|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} Yetis also [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hit other monsters as a +1 weapon]].

===Lethe patch===
In the [[Lethe patch]], seven yetis are generated in the lair of [[Geryon]] within [[Gehennom (Lethe patch)|Gehennom]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], the weight of a yeti's corpse is increased by 1000 [[aum]] (more than 50%), and their base experience is increased; they can also no longer be tamed.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], yeti have their base experience decreased to 29 and cannot appear in Gehennom, but are otherwise identical to vanilla yeti.
